event: history of methicillin-resistant Staphylococcus aureus (MRSA) impetigo at the forearm
history of right tibia fracture treated with intramedullary fixation (IMN)
interlocking screws removed due to skin irritation and pain
redness and swelling at the surgical site
cultures from the surgical site were positive for MRSA
returned to the ER with a fever and right groin pain
discharged home with the diagnosis of viral infection
returned to the ER with a systemic fever
hepatic enzymes, lactic dehydrogenase (LDH), creatine phosphokinase (CPK) levels were also elevated
radiograph of both hips in anterior-posterior view was unremarkable
advised to start the treatment with intravenous (IV) antibiotics
positron emission tomography-computed tomography (PET-CT) scan was conducted
revealed OIM abscess with systemic manifestations
blood cultures were positive for MRSA bacteria
admitted to the intensive care unit (ICU)
result showed further enlargement of the abscesses diameter
combined approach of Smith-Peterson and modified Stoppa was chosen
less frequent fever spikes were noticed
decrease in CRP and WBC levels
additional antibiotic treatment support for 6 weeks
able to ambulate normally without any pain or functional limitations
